item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 13, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. CRLF is obsolete and should be abolished (49 points | 8 comments)
2. Starship Flight 5: Launch and booster catch [video] (1136 points | 684 comments)
3. Making the Tibetan language a first-class citizen in the digital world (53 points | 14 comments)
4. Fish Out of Water: The Military Is an Impossible Place for Hackers, What to Do (13 points | 4 comments)
5. The quiet art of attention (172 points | 73 comments)
6. ACF Plugin no longer available on WordPress.org (85 points | 23 comments)
7. Diffusion for World Modeling (370 points | 174 comments)
8. A novel channel contention mechanism for improving wi-fi's reliability (57 points | 21 comments)
9. Restic: Backups done right (80 points | 39 comments)
10. What is considered ‘moderate drinking’? (18 points | 36 comments)
11. Common Lisp implementation of the Forth 2012 Standard (78 points | 36 comments)
12. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (273 points | 232 comments)
13. Lessons learned from profiling an algorithm in Rust (67 points | 9 comments)
14. Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes (45 points | 21 comments)
15. Ward Christensen (of BBS and XMODEM fame) has died (124 points | 28 comments)
16. A Dictionary of Single-Letter Variable Names (6 points | 1 comment)
17. Exploring Typst, a new typesetting system similar to LaTeX (489 points | 191 comments)
18. DARPA Thinks Walls of Oysters Could Protect Shores Against Hurricanes (61 points | 17 comments)
19. Even a Single Bacterial Cell Can Sense the Seasons Changing (13 points | 7 comments)
20. Show HN: I've added undo and redo to IsoCity (9 points | 4 comments)
21. Can logic programming be liberated from predicates and backtracking? [pdf] (164 points | 52 comments)
22. Pepsi’s Soviet Navy (2021) (53 points | 14 comments)
23. Interview with Yann LeCun on AI (28 points | 27 comments)
24. When is causal broadcast not enough for causal memory? (11 points | discuss)
25. Scientists found a way to make sound travel in only one direction (50 points | 7 comments)
26. 1 bug, $50k in bounties, a Zendesk backdoor (1430 points | 386 comments)
27. Eating less can lead to a longer life: study in mice shows why (191 points | 135 comments)
28. The Surprising Predictability of Long Runs (2012) [pdf] (35 points | 9 comments)
29. Every bug/quirk of the Windows resource compiler (rc.exe), probably (201 points | 19 comments)
30. Omni SenseVoice: High-Speed Speech Recognition with Words Timestamps (143 points | 25 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 13, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
